TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BrowserCapabilitiesFactoryBase extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The BrowserCapabilitiesFactoryBase class is the base class from which is derived. It is used internally at run time by the configuration system to create request-specific instances of the class, publicly accessed through the ASP.NET intrinsic property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You define browser capabilities in a .browser file. You can use the default hierarchy in the .browser file or create a custom hierarchy to define the browser capabilities.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Used internally by the configuration system to create a new instance of this class.
Used internally by the configuration system to represent a collection of information relating to various browser capabilities.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ConfigureBrowserCapabilities (System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection headers, System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities browserCaps);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ConfigureBrowserCapabilities(class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection headers, class System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities browserCaps) cil managed

Docs.summary: Used internally at run time to configure an object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ConfigureCustomCapabilities (System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection headers, System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities browserCaps);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ConfigureCustomCapabilities(class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection headers, class System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities browserCaps) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that specifies the capabilities of the browser.
Docs.summary: Used internally at run time to configure custom hierarchies of browser capabilities.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You define browser capabilities in a .browser file. You can use the default hierarchy in the .browser file or create a custom hierarchy to define the browser capabilities. The ConfigureCustomCapabilities method processes a custom hierarchy. The custom hierarchy must contain a `parentID` value in the `browser` element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance bool IsBrowserUnknown(class System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase browserCaps) cil managed

Docs.summary: Used internally by the configuration system to determine whether the browser represented by the specified object does not have an available adapter.
Used internally by the configuration system to represent a collection of request-header values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void PopulateBrowserElements(class System.Collections.IDictionary dictionary) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of key/value pairs representing the browser capabilities.
Docs.summary: Used internally by the configuration system to populate a collection of browser capabilities based on the supported browser.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void PopulateMatchedHeaders(class System.Collections.IDictionary dictionary) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of key/value pairs representing the browser capabilities.
Docs.summary: Used internally by the configuration system to populate a collection of request headers based on the supported browser.
